name: Sapporo Rock-N-Roll Sushi
description: This place slaps. Super fresh sushi, friendly staff, delicious cooked dishes for your non-sushi eating friends, and amazing happy hour deals. Pro tip: order off the menu and ask for the "secret box" - an ever-changing section of daily highlights with raw and cooked exclusive gems. Tell them the team at Recapped.io sent you and you'll get 10% off your bill!
address: 2456 S El Camino Real, San Mateo, CA 94403

name: Espetus Churrascaria
description: Your classic Brazilian steakhouse. Does it get better than a parade of servers coming up to you and cutting meat off a stick tableside? We think not. Just make sure to bring your appetite.
address: 710 South B St, San Mateo, CA 94401

name: Limon
description: Offering modern Peruvian and Latin fusion dishes in a celebratory and welcoming atmosphere. This is a family owned and run business and they try to treat you like a member of the family. Their sangria is hella good. In short, this joint never disappoints.

name: The Barrel Bistro And Wine Bar
description: The vibe here feels like if a fancy wine store opened up their floor to serve their customers meals and glasses of wine. There's a wide variety of classic food pairings for your wine order. They've got a great rotating wine list.
address: 246 S B St, San Mateo, CA 94401

name: Evvia
description: If you like Greek food, but still want something elevated and refined, Evvia is the place for you. They've got a super cute outdoor patio and the entire place is just the ideal combination of sophistication and old-world charm. A rustic fireplace warms the room while the large, polished wood Chefâ€™s table, hand-made pottery and copper cookware create the feel of a Mediterranean country inn. The ambiance sets the stage for a most memorable dining experience. This is one of the best restaurants in the area bar none.

name: Sundance The Steakhouse
description: When you hear "steak house" what comes to your mind? Chances are you've probably come pretty close to imaging Sundance. It's designed with that in mind, your classic steak house with leather booths, a candlelit mahogany dining room, generous cuts of perfectly cooked prime rib and Angus steaks, seafood and a 450-item wine list. Sit back, relax and loosen your belt a notch or two.
address: 1921 El Camino Real, Palo Alto, CA 94306

name: Tamarine Restaurant
description: We love Vietnamese food because it's got that balance of being fresh and healthy and comforting. But sometimes it is nice to share that experience in an elevated way. Enter Tamarine. Order anything on the menu, you can't go wrong here. Just do yourself a favor and save a little room for the banana beignets as a dessert.

name: Pacific Catch
description: Why settle for one type of cuisine when you can sample the entire Pacific Ocean? Their diverse menu is inspired by flavors of the Pacific and features freshly prepared bowls, tacos, sushi, poke and signature sandwiches such as their Lobster Roll and Wagyu Cheeseburger. Tell them the team at Recapped.io sent you and you'll get 15% off your bill!
address: 243 S B St, San Mateo, CA 94401

name: Pancho Villa Taqueria
description: You've come all this way, so you have to try a burrito, right? Well, now you know where to go.  Look, it's a simple place, you order at the counter and seat your self. But the food is fresh and they often have interesting burrito combos you're not gonna find at your local Chipotle.
address: 365 S B St, San Mateo, CA 94401

name: The Fish Market - San Mateo
description: Forget farm to table, it's all about the ocean to table now, but we also love their gluten free and vegan options. If you're looking for shellfish, we recommend the king crab legs.
address: 1855 S Norfolk St, San Mateo, CA 94403

name: Nola
description: A hella good tribute to N'awlins with a cute outdoor space and one of the largest collections of authentic Southern Folkart west of the Mississippi. Get your fix of cajun classics and cocktails served in pitchers (or regular glasses if you so desire). Tryna squeeze out a little more summer before giving in to fall? Grab yourself a boozy slush. Tell them the team at Recapped.io sent you and you'll get 20% off your bill!

name: Mortar & Pestle
description: Chic cocktails and Indian food that just slaps. The best combo bar naan. This spot has Indian-inspired libations you won't find anywhere else. We love their smoke-infused cocktails to wind down our day. Pair it with whatever Indian street food tickles your fancy and thank us later. Tell them the team at Recapped.io sent you and you'll get 15% off your bill!

name: The Swingin' Door
description: Wednesday night karaoke so you can annoy everyone with your rendition of Fancy Like. If you're looking for fish and chips or your typical British Pub, look no further. It's an intimate, hole in the wall spot that's well suited for small groups. A good place to bump elbows with some of the locals from the Bay Area. If you're in town a bit early and looking for something on Sunday night, they've got trivia.

name: Barrelhouse
description: Outdoor seating and bougie cocktails, what more could you ask for? You won't find a full food menu here, but their empanadas and adult lunchables (or charcuterie boards, if you're pedantic) will hit the spot. Get 1/2 OFF Canyon Road Bottles of Wine from Sunday through Wednesday.

name: O'Neill's Irish Pub
description: Your typical Irish Sports Bar for when you just need a drink. It's small, cozy and a little basic, but that's also part of the charm. Sometimes you just need a no-fuss spot, right? They offer karaoke on Tuesday nights and pub quizzes on Wednesday nights.
address: 34 South B Street, San Mateo, CA

name: Route 92 Sports Bar
description: What happens when a dive bar meets a sports bar? Route 92 - a fun, laid back atmosphere with a friendly mix of locals. This is a good spot to go if you don't need all the frills, but like being a little more active than sitting on a stool all night tossing 'em back. Come here if you're looking to shoot some pool, throw some darts, play some shuffle board, or play some tunes on the juke box. And did we mention they have Golden Tee?
address: 2128 S El Camino Real, San Mateo, CA

name: Bucky's Cocktail Lounge
description: A true locals hangout. An unpretentious spot to avoid the tech bros. If you're looking for a fun but low-key night out, and you're not working with a massive expense account, Bucky's has got you covered. They also have a spacious backyard with lighting, giving it a fun and relaxed vibe.

name: Flights 101 Club Lounge
description: Awesome views of the bay and conveniently located near the airport (they've got a free shuttle, so this can be a good spot to hang before your flight). They've got a spacious lounge and some tasty bites, but you will pay a premium for the convenience factor. Still, this can be a nice spot to hit up before or after a night out.

name: B Street & Vine
description: This is a nice and cozy indoor/outdoor wine bar. Besides their extensive wine list, try their tapas or their fancy bruschetta combos - which really stand out. Like why wouldn't you want a grand selection of bruschetta to choose from to eat with a glass of wine and good company after a day of checking out SaaStr events?
address: 320 S B St, San Mateo, CA

name: Paddy Flynn's
description: If It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia was made in San Mateo, it would take place at Paddy's. It's a family run spot, and ok, they're much more put together than the IASIP gang, they stay true to the local dive bar atmosphere. They specialize in Irish drinks like Guinness, Jameson and other Irish whiskey, beers, and ciders.

name: The Wine Room Palo Alto
description: Cozy and convivial, this rustic wine bar pours select global vintages by the glass in a cool adobe (architecture) building with a lovely lounge area. The building reminds you of a mid century Mission style with the red clay roof tiles. It's small and intimate and dark in a good way. They don't really serve meals, but you can get some good snacks and sweets to pair with the wine. Here, it's all about the wine.

name: The Patio
description: Not to be confused by the coffee shop which bears the same name, The Patio is home to the longest bar in Palo Alto. You can expect 20+ flat screen TV's, DJ entertainment, dancing, karaoke, trivia, happy hour and of course... a large outdoor seating area, hence their namesake. This is a great spot for happy hour and a casual hangout. Just be warned, it does have a tendency to get packed.

name: Old Pro
description: Your classic local sports bar with a California twist. After all, only in Cali do game-day eats include trendy, locally sourced fare like Smoked Diestel Turkey Chili, made with organic, non-GMO turkey; an Avocado-Kale Caesar salad; and Crispy Brussels Sprouts with a Thai chile glaze. There's a ton of TV's both inside and out, and a great atmosphere. If you're feeling adventurous, hop on their mechanical bull.

name: Suavecito Birria & Tacos
description: If Maryland does crab cakes and football, Cali does Mexican food. If you're visiting from out of state, it's something you just have to try. This is a takeout only joint, but in our opinion, it's the best Mexican food you'll find close to the events at SaaStr. Tell them the team at Recapped.io sent you and you'll get 15% off your bill!
address: 1100 South Amphlett Blvd, San Mateo, CA

name: Crepevine Restaurant
description: Yes, they serve more than crepes, and yes, their other dishes are good, but are you really gonna be that person who goes to a place named Crepevine and then not order a crepe?

name: Jack's Restaurant & Bar San Mateo
description: Come to Jack's if you have a hankering for classic American dishes. This is a good spot for breakfast as well. Very delicious food, strong drinks, and attentive staff. What more could you ask for?
address: 1750 S El Camino Real, San Mateo, CA 94402

name: Mingalaba
description: How often do you get to dine on Burmese cuisine? This spot has Burmese and Chinese dishes with lots of spicy options, if that's your thing. Also, plenty of great vegan options. If you're looking for something a little different, and tend to like Asian food, give this spot a try.

name: Rise Woodfire
description: Elevated comfort food featuring wood-fired pizza and rotisserie fare in the heart of Downtown San Mateo by the train station. If you're not amped for pizza, they've got prime rib and French Dip sandwiches that we're big fans of.
address: 2 N B St, San Mateo, CA 94401

name: Taverna
description: The food may be upscale Greek, but the dining experience is much more low-key. A good spot if you like great food without pretentiousness. At the same time, you can expect super attentive staff and possibly the highest level of service you'll experience eating out. If your team needs to improve their customer relationship services, take them here so they can see how it's done.
